sections.heading: What is Masen Form?
sections.content:
ません (masen) form is the polite negative present/future tense. It means "don't/won't do something" politely.

食べません (tabemasen) - don't eat / won't eat 行きません (ikimasen) - don't go / won't go しません (shimasen) - don't do / won't do

sections.heading: How to Form Masen
sections.content:
Simple rule: Take the masu form and change ます to ません

食べます → 食べません 行きます → 行きません します → しません

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content: 書く → 書きます → 書きません (don't write) 飲む → 飲みます → 飲みません (don't drink) 買う → 買います → 買いません (don't buy) 話す → 話します → 話しません (don't speak) 待つ → 待ちます → 待ちません (don't wait) 遊ぶ → 遊びます → 遊びません (don't play) 読む → 読みます → 読みません (don't read) 帰る → 帰ります → 帰りません (don't return)

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content: 食べる → 食べます → 食べません (don't eat) 見る → 見ます → 見ません (don't see) 寝る → 寝ます → 寝ません (don't sleep) 起きる → 起きます → 起きません (don't wake up) 教える → 教えます → 教えません (don't teach)

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → します → しません (don't do) 来る → 来ます → 来ません (don't come)

sections.heading: Conjugation Chart
sections.content: | Dictionary | Masu | Masen | Meaning | | ---------- | -------- | ---------- | ----------- | | 食べる | 食べます | 食べません | don't eat | | 行く | 行きます | 行きません | don't go | | 見る | 見ます | 見ません | don't see | | する | します | しません | don't do | | 来る | 来ます | 来ません | don't come | | 飲む | 飲みます | 飲みません | don't drink |

children.heading: 1. Stating You Don't Do Something
children.content: 私はお酒を飲みません "I don't drink alcohol" 肉を食べません "I don't eat meat" タバコを吸いません "I don't smoke"

children.heading: 2. Future Negative (Won't Do)
children.content: 明日は行きません "I won't go tomorrow" 今日は勉強しません "I won't study today" 週末は働きません "I won't work on the weekend"

children.heading: 3. Polite Refusals
children.content: すみません、分かりません "Sorry, I don't understand" 今日は大丈夫じゃありません "Today is not okay"

children.heading: 4. Negative Habits
children.content: 朝ご飯を食べません "I don't eat breakfast" テレビを見ません "I don't watch TV" コーヒーを飲みません "I don't drink coffee"

children.heading: Present Habitual
children.content: 私は肉を食べません "I don't eat meat" (habitual) 毎日運動しません "I don't exercise every day"

children.heading: Future
children.content: 明日は行きません "I won't go tomorrow" 今晩食べません "I won't eat tonight"

sections.heading: Question Form
sections.content:
Add か at the end:

日本語を話しませんか？ "Don't you speak Japanese?" 明日来ませんか？ "Won't you come tomorrow?" コーヒーを飲みませんか？ "Won't you drink coffee?" (invitation)

sections.heading: Invitations with Masen ka
sections.content:
ませんか is commonly used for gentle invitations:

一緒に行きませんか？ "Won't you go together?" (= Would you like to go together?) 映画を見ませんか？ "Won't you watch a movie?" (= Would you like to watch a movie?) お茶を飲みませんか？ "Won't you have tea?" (= Would you like some tea?)

More polite than ますか!

children.heading: Positive Answers (Yes, I don't)
children.content: Q: お酒を飲みませんか？ "Don't you drink alcohol?" A: はい、飲みません "Right, I don't drink"

children.heading: Negative Answers (No, I do)
children.content:
Q: 明日行きませんか？ "Won't you go tomorrow?" A: いいえ、行きます "No, I will go"

Note: Japanese yes/no can be confusing! はい agrees with the negative statement.

children.heading: Preferences
children.content: 私は朝早く起きません "I don't wake up early in the morning" あまり外食しません "I don't eat out much" ほとんど運動しません "I hardly exercise"

children.heading: Abilities (Cannot)
children.content: 日本語が分かりません "I don't understand Japanese" 漢字が読めません "I can't read kanji" 料理ができません "I can't cook"

children.heading: Restrictions
children.content: ここで写真を撮りません "We don't take photos here" この部屋に入りません "We don't enter this room"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Double Negative
children.content: Wrong: 食べませんない ❌ Right: 食べません ✓

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using Nai with Masu Stem
children.content: Wrong: 食べまない ❌ Right: 食べません ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with Plain Negative
children.content: Formal context: Wrong: 行かない ❌ Right: 行きません ✓

children.heading: Mistake 4: Wrong Masu Stem
children.content: Wrong: 帰る → 帰ません ❌ Right: 帰る → 帰りません ✓

sections.heading: Masen vs Nai
sections.content:
Two ways to say negative:

| Polite (Masen) | Plain (Nai) | Meaning | | -------------- | ----------- | ---------- | | 食べません | 食べない | don't eat | | 行きません | 行かない | don't go | | しません | しない | don't do | | 来ません | 来ない | don't come |

Use ません in polite situations!

sections.heading: Dietary Restrictions
sections.content: 私はベジタリアンです。肉を食べません "I'm vegetarian. I don't eat meat" アレルギーがあります。ナッツを食べません "I have allergies. I don't eat nuts" お酒が飲めません "I can't drink alcohol"

children.heading: Example 1: Invitation
children.content: A: 今晩映画を見ませんか？ "Would you like to watch a movie tonight?" B: すみません、今日は忙しいです。行きません "Sorry, I'm busy today. I won't go" A: じゃあ、週末はどうですか？ "Then, how about the weekend?" B: 週末はいいですよ！ "The weekend is good!"

children.heading: Example 2: Preferences
children.content: A: コーヒーを飲みますか？ "Do you drink coffee?" B: いいえ、飲みません。お茶を飲みます "No, I don't. I drink tea" A: そうですか。紅茶はどうですか？ "I see. How about black tea?" B: はい、紅茶は飲みます "Yes, I drink black tea"

children.heading: Example 3: Daily Habits
children.content: A: 毎日運動しますか？ "Do you exercise every day?" B: いいえ、しません。時々運動します "No, I don't. I exercise sometimes"

sections.heading: With Frequency Adverbs
sections.content: ぜんぜん食べません "I don't eat at all" あまり飲みません "I don't drink much" ほとんど行きません "I hardly go" めったに見ません "I rarely watch"

children.heading: I Don't Know
children.content: 分かりません "I don't know / I don't understand" 知りません "I don't know (factual information)"

children.heading: I Don't Have
children.content: お金がありません "I don't have money" 時間がありません "I don't have time"

children.heading: Can't/Unable to
children.content: できません "I can't do it" 行けません "I can't go"

sections.heading: Reasons for Not Doing
sections.content: 時間がないので、行きません "I don't have time, so I won't go" 疲れたから、今日は遊びません "I'm tired, so I won't play today" お金がないので、買いません "I don't have money, so I won't buy it"

sections.heading: Past Negative: ませんでした
sections.content:
食べません → 食べませんでした (didn't eat) 行きません → 行きませんでした (didn't go)

More details in the past negative lesson.

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ ません = polite negative present/future ✓ Form: ます → ません ✓ Express habits and refusals politely ✓ ませんか = gentle invitation ✓ Same for all verb groups ✓ More polite than ない form ✓ Essential for polite conversation

Master ません form - it's crucial for polite negative statements!
